snippet.title: How To Use Comparison Operators In Java
snippet.description:
New course coming soon! Learn Java Fast launches on July 1st, 2020. Stay informed and join the waitlist: https://course.alexlorenlee.com/courses/learn-java-fast

- This is the exact code for comparison operators in java! ✅I show each comparison operator and how to use them.

👑Start practicing now with 10 free java programs - http://alexlorenlee.com/
🌅 Source Code - https://github.com/alexlorenlee/JavaTutorialCode/blob/master/Conditionals/ComparisonOperators.java

You can compare two variables by using == and != etc.

a == b

This checks if the variable a, holds the same value as variable b. If it does, then it turns into true. If not, then false. You'll most often using comparison operators in if statements. 

Comparison operators in java can be tricky at first... But SURELY you'll get it :) If you followed along, congrats! You learned-by-doing!

I hope you enjoyed this tutorial on how to use comparison operators in java! I like to have a nice mix of tutorials and actual projects for you all :)

Do you want to learn how to code from scratch, in Java? Check out my Java Tutorial For Beginners: https://youtu.be/woJb2hAfkO0

What are you using comparison operators in java for? -

Free tips and programs: http://alexlorenlee.com
